Reviews.Title: “Closed”
Reviews.Author: dgehret
Reviews.Content: I had reservations for 7/25/09, I recieved an e-mail that moringingt, that my paid room was moved 6 miloes away., In was trying to catch a plane and rescheduled my hotel at the same time! Talk about a stressful start to a vacation. The holtel is closed due to bankruptcy! Do not book with this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared off by all the bad reviews.”
Reviews.Author: bobbystoney
Reviews.Content: Like somebody else mentioned I was pretty bummed after booking this hotel through Hotwire. I shouldn't have been. Me and my family had a great stay. We also stayed at the Shores Hotel and Spa and although it was very nice I think next year we will just stay here the whole time to save some money. I don't think it was worth the extra $100 + per night at the Shores. We got everything we pretty much wanted and needed here at Surfside.

Reviews.Title: “do not consider regardless of cost”
Reviews.Author: pattijay36
Reviews.Content: room was fair as far as cleaniness. the door to the balcony was falling apart. the restraunt was only open a few hrs. on saturday morning. no complimentary coffee offered which would be appreciated with no restraunt. worst of all the elevator malfunction and we got stuck inside.we pressed the intercom and bell. at no time did anyone speak with us to keep us calm . the elevator door closed and never advanced off the first floor but the door would not open. an apology was never given to us. this hotel is in need of desperate tlc.

Reviews.Title: “A good budget hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: fattourist
Reviews.Content: Balconies are not enclosed so you do see and hear your neighbors if you utilize them.The pool is nice ,bar and restaurant are not open and will not be when you go there. For the cost its a good choice, the outside looks shabby but the rooms are cold, noise free, and large.The location is on the beach with great access to dunlawton bridge.

Reviews.Title: “at first i was worried after already booking then reading reviews but....”
Reviews.Author: suprbuzerd
Reviews.Content: My stay was great enjoyed my time there I had my father, my nephew 11yrs, daughter 12yrs, and daughter 2 years....Granted this is not a luxury hotel but it easily met our needs while we were there!!! We were supposed to have a view of the city but still had beach view from the balcony! The staff was nice we did not have any problems there. Only down side the Wi Fi didn't work on my laptop and there was a 5.00 additional parking fee I am not sure if other hotels do the same. The room was very clean. We brought our own beach towels for swimming....

Reviews.Title: “Liked the central location”
Reviews.Author: NascarFanFlorida
Reviews.Content: We went to the Daytona 500 as recommended and told not to book a room until we got out there; from experience my boyfriend booked a room a few years ago in advance and was very disappointed. We stopped at a hotel on Atlantic Blvd and was recommended to the Surfside Hotel; we were kind of worried at first because why were so many hotels sold out and this hotel had vacancies. To are surprise we were quite pleased; we plan on going back again for the Pepsi 400.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected visitors...”
Reviews.Author: travel2moche
Reviews.Content: I was dissapointed when I saw that Hotwire booked me at the Surfside. The reviews online were pretty bad... I even called to complain but they told me I had to check in before they do something. I made it there and, to my surprise, the hotel was not bad. The service was not great when we got there, the decor was certainly outdated but our room had been renovated and was clean. No problem the first two night and I thought I had made a pretty good deal for $36/night and they even provided free wifi (plus $5/night for parking???). I was going to write my possitive comments on tripadvisor before going to bed for my last night when I saw something moving on the floor near the TV... I managed to catch the cockroach on a plastic glass and took it to the front desk. They didn't know what to answer and proposed to move us up to another room right above the one we had... I don't think that would have solved the problem. I called Hotwire to complain and ask for a refund since we didn't want to sleep there. They agreed and we moved to a motel nearby... This hotel is not too bad for the price if you don't mind unnexpected visitors for the night!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smells of Mold and Mildew!”
Reviews.Author: cchfla
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk into the hotel to check in you notice the smell of mold and mildew. It only gets worse as you go up to your room. It was so bad in our room we packed up to drive home 2 hours after we got there. As we went to check out they offered us to look at another room. The smell was not as intense so we stuck it out till morning and hauled butt out of there! I will say the views from the rooms of the ocean are very nice. But thats it. The hotel needs a full refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “See the pictures”
Reviews.Author: jbrown1269
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through a site that doesn't tell you the name until you pay. They credited my account promptly after I described my experience. I attached pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean”
Reviews.Author: craigco33
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our stay here and would have left immediately but for the fact that it was july 4 th and race week so nothing else was available. The lamp shade was so covered with dust that it looked furry. There was food behind the nightstand,fingernail clippings on the carpet beside the bed and a plastic dart under the bed. It all was still there when we left! I wouldn't walk on the floor without my shoes on.The room was filthy when we arrived and wasn't cleaned the whole time. Lobby elevator and room smelled mildewy sour.Bad experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!!”
Reviews.Author: Luvya
Reviews.Content: I convinced myself that the 2 1/2 star rating and the price would be suitable for what I needed but I would not pick this place again! The main problem is it is very old and smelly. It's just a slight notch above a sleazy motel, in my opinion. The carpet was filthy. We didn't dare walk on it without shoes. The ceiling was either very dirty (somehow), or coated with mildew - we never could figure out which. We had to spray Febreeze to try to mitigate the stale musty smell. There was visible signs of rust, corrosion and mildew in the room. Lampshade was very dusty. The balcony was more of the same or worse - very old and dirty. Overall, we spent most of the day out of the room and couldn't wait to check out! The staff was friendly but the place is just old and run down. We could see that attempts have been made to upgrade the rooms but there's only so much fixing up you can do to a very old and smelly place like this. Unless you're desperate my advice is DON"T DO IT!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: kirbahashi
Reviews.Content: Straight up, understand that this is not a luxury hotel. There are other hotels on this beach of far greater quality AND at a greater price! i am not going to trash this hotel as it met our needs. Just be advised that this isn't the Hilton. Now for this Hotel. My family and I found it adequate for our needs. Pluses: Cheap price, um... free wi-fi, it's on the beach, and did I mention it was cheap. The AC worked well too. Negatives: The hotel elevators sounded bad and riding them was an adventure. AND like everything else in Florida, you had to wait for one. The bathrooms were small and not well ventilated. At the pool, they frequently ran out of towels, and took forever to restock. And forget any towels poolside after 6pm. Cheap prices equal large groups as we had a youth group staying throughout the hotel and did THEY have fun! The beds could use an upgrade just like everything else here. I couldn't really tell you about the bar or buffet, but both looked good to go. The bar stayed open until 10 every night. The parking lot was covered so your car didn't roast while parked ($5 per night though). The rate I paid was dirt cheap. for the three nights we stayed, the cost was equal to one night according to the going rate so all in all, it was what I expected. Had I paid full price I would be a little upset. As I said, there are better hotels than this, how much to do you want to pay though? I am sure the place rocked back during the 70's and 80's. But in 2008, it really needs a facelift! Would I stay here again??? Only if I got the same price and not one penny more. Oh... Ocean view means just that... you have a view (not directly) of the ocean ;)

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: mikefCentralFlorida
Reviews.Content: This place really needs some updating. Furniture all over, lobby and rooms worn. Exercise room 4 machines and 3 do not work. Dirty lobby and just feels dirty and smelly. Bed was ok, shower would not drain properly and shower head broken. Towels in bathroom Motel 6 grade at best. Cheapest on Atlantic Ave so I got what I paid for maybe. Will know better next time. Have to end with a positive in that the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for here, NOT MUCH!!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl040
Reviews.Content: This place is a dump! The staff is unfriendly. Was told (actually shouted at) that there was NO CHECK INS until 3pm. Went to the desk at 3pm to check in and waited in line that was outside the door. There was one person checking everyone in. The lobby is musty & out dated. The furniture is old and scary. Was afraid to sit down. The pool is nothing special. There was one thread bare towel in the "pool towels" bin the entire two days I was there. They want to give you the most disgusting towels so noone will steal them! The room was just ok. No attempts to make it look appealing. White walls, old pictures, ugly thin bed spreads, flat pillows, thread bare towels, not much else. You pay to park & for a safe in your room. What a joke! We had booked this hotel and paid already online or else we would have left immediately. Pay the extra $$ and go elsewhere. We couldn't wait to leave! Never again....

Reviews.Title: “To the point”
Reviews.Author: nurse1Apopka
Reviews.Content: FLAT pillows - No reception on radio - ceiling FALLING IN all over the floor - DIRTY windows - BAR closes at 8 pm OR before. Restaurant is only breakfast (7:30-11 am). NO dividers between balconies so feel like family with your neighbor. Staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Surfside Service”
Reviews.Author: nadradt
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called for directions, the service stood out at this Daytona Beach Shores hotel! The hotel staff was not only highly professional, courteous, and friendly, but extremely genuine in their concerns in making sure my stay was as pleasant as could be. In a town riddled with hotels, The Surfside Hotel proved that their service is the one to beat by providing customer value through quality, intangibles, and an incredible price for the view! Bottom-line... Highly Recommended!! Nadra Beauford

Reviews.Title: “Works for me - Typical Daytona beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gridiron
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire about a month ago. Hotwire recently downgraded this hotel to 2 1/2 stars which I think is pretty much on par for the accomodations. I must add they gave me $125 in Hotdollars for keeping the reservation. I still had major worries about this hotel before today. I am typing this right from my hotel room. The bad: The hotel is a bit rough around the edges. Things are not perfect and are a bit outdated. The lobby could use some renovations to keep it up to day. Some new windows, new carpets, etc in the rooms would be a good idea to charge top rates. There is a beachside musty smell in the hotel but it isn't offensive and is extremely typical for beachside hotels. The pool is fine. There is no hottub only a kiddie pool . The good: Even though the hotel is rough the rooms are clean. Our carpets were clean but a bit worn near the bathroom. Everything works in the room. There is a microwave, mini fridge and coffee maker. The air/heater unit works great. The beds are comfortable and lean to the soft side IMHO. The musty smell in the hotel disappeared in the room. The hotel is directly on the beach as advertised. The location is excellent. So what should you expect to pay for a room? Well I am here in the offseason and paid $46 a night on Hotwire. Completely reasonable and I am happy to pay that rate. What is it worth? I would say at least $70/night in the offseason. We also were able to upgrade to a beachfront room after the first day for $10/night. The room quality was the same but the view was worth it. The beds were firmer in the beachfront rooms. Bottom line is the hotel really is not bad. It is safe, pretty clean and has a great location. Don't panic if you booked this place through Hotwire or Priceline.. Your vacation will be just fine. Just don't expect the Hilton. Expect a typical beachfront stand alone hotel and you will be happy happy happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Teddybear87
Reviews.Content: This is a joke of a hotel. I won this trip through our local radio station. I tried to find reviews on it, but really didn't find much. My family spent the most part at Walt Disney World then we headed to this hotel for 2 days and 2 nights. Upon arrival, the place was dirty, the outside looked run down (not like the beautiful picture above), the place smelled musty. After entering the room, theres a note on the door to the balcony stating, keep closed due to high winds. The door was also short 1/2 inch from closing at the top. The carpeting up the wall (molding area) was coming off. The bathroom was dirty. There was no way we could stay at this place. My husband didn't feel safe with us staying there either. We ended up going North and staying at the Hilton - which is also on the beach. No musty smell, clean, nice place to stay. Needless to say, we were upset we had to change plans and end up going home a day earlier then anticipated. I think that they should not post the "nice" pictures - but actually take another look at this so called hotel. I wouldn't want anyone staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Surfside Hotel Nothing Like Advertised”
Reviews.Author: lcrayton1
Reviews.Content: Texas: The Surfside Hotel, Daytona Beach: "Absolutely horrible!" Date: November 27, 2007 Maybe when the Surfside was new it looked like the pictures on their website, but it is no longer new and those pictures in no way apply. The only thing from the website that appears to be correct is that it is on the beach. During my stay, there was no heated pool, the laundry room was filthy with nowhere near the number of washers and dryers shown in the picture on their website. The elevators either did not work or got stuck between floors. The roaches were so bad that they would come out and cross the tables even while games of cards were being played. We were there over Thanksgiving for a youth league football tournament and were not even allowed to use a banquet room to set up Thanksgiving dinner for our families. I think the idea was to persuade us to buy their Thanksgiving dinner which would have cost almost $20 a plate. The ocean was nice, but this hotel is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed12
Reviews.Content: Needed more housekeeping maintenance in the common areas. The same half english muffin sat near the elevator on the first floor for two days. It may still be there!! The elevators were filthy with litter. I felt that if housekeeping patrolled the area several times a day, this could have been eliminated. Also, the restaurant was closed the whole time we were there. I guess you can only get a few items from room service. Made me wonder why. Didn't appreciate being charged for the in-room safe per day - even if I would have used it. The $5 a day parking was also over the top. Would we stay again - I really don't think so. On a positive note, the desk attendants were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Two star hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertalee
Reviews.Content: We staryed at the Surfside through a timeshare promotion for three nights. We did not know they charged $5 a night to park there and $1.50 plus tax for the room safe. Employees had good customer service. One elevator squealled as the door shut - scary. Somewhat musty, but the ocean is right there. Hot tub water cold; pool water bearable. Washer/dryer area nasty-one washer had dirty water in it and two dryers were broken. Would have liked to have sat in the lounge and watch the ocean, but it is only open on weekends during this season. Dinky one cup coffeemaker with one package of regular coffee; maid did provide more when requested. Chairs were dirty; poor room layout; no nightstand - had to pull the table over by the bed to use as a nightstand. The refrigerator/microwave were on the other side of the bed. Good water pressure in the shower, but dinky space to put toiletries on in the bathroom. And why is there a mirror stuck in the middle of the wall? If went back would book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Run down, poorly maintained & rude”
Reviews.Author: babsysmithy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very run down and poorly maintained. The security locks on the exterior doors were broken and hanging off the doors. The entire hotel had a very bad musty odor. The room was clean looking but smelled horrible. The exterior door of our room was rotted in places. The door knob did not work. The deadbolt was the only thing that held it closed. The desk clerk wasn't overtly rude but was certainly not pleasant and welcoming. This should not be listed as a three star hotel and is misrepresented by every travel site I have seen it listed on.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: sidepocket51
Reviews.Content: We came up for Jeep Beach Weekend in May of 2007. We had a great time. The hotel was very clean. The people there were so nice. Very nice rooms, and a balcony looking out over the ocean. A lounge with very friendly people, and a game room for the kids. We will definitely be booking again for May 16th to the 18th of 2008 for the next Jeep Beach Weekend. Gary M. Specht

Reviews.Title: “Just what I was looking clean and relaxing. I would defently stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: browneyes418
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in if your traveling alone. The room was clean and the rug was clean and they even cleaned the rug during my stay there. It was a very relaxing time. My room was a ocean view which was perfect. They had a restaurant but only for breakfast which i would not recommend there is more places to eat in walking distance. Ihop, Denny's and a great place to eat for breakfast CRACKED EGG or you can take the bus to plubix supermarket they have everything you need. If you did not rent a car the transportation is excellent the bus stops right in front of hotel which runs every hour and every half an hour there is trolley that runs. If you are looking for a limited amount of kids or family's don't stay here alot of kids which i didn't care for and the gym needs better equipment and more machines to workout on and some weights too I was very disappointed on the gym i was looking forward to use it during my stay i used it ones and then worked out in my room the rest of my stay. They also need to fix the elevators and clean the rugs in them or just replace them. The elevators near the pool entrance had a foul smell. The pool was great if you wanted to swim laps do it the morning before 11:00am to 12:00pm before the kids got there. The hotel is right on the beach which was excellent. Also if your looking for great seafood restaurants go to the light house they have a couple there or go to the downtown daytona area. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a great time”
Reviews.Author: mikito30
Reviews.Content: This place was just purchased by a new company. we stayed during the takeover. The new company is like night and day compared to the old 1. We have stayed here before. The staff are very friendly, we had an oceanview room it was spectactular. you have the ocean on 1 side and the river on the other. it was beautiful. The room is your typical king room, loads of amentiies. you could see the difference in the place when the new company took over. The staff was smiling, the food was excellent. they were doing some cleanup and small renovations to the landscaping. I talked to a manager and he told us all about the plans they have for the hotel. new menus, extended hours. My kids loved the pool. Oh and this place is loaded with fish tanks everywhere. A great stay and we cant wait to return to see all the changes

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: parealtor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a 2 night stay at the hotel for veiwing a time share. The hotel is a bit dated and run down. The carpets in the elevator were moldy and smelled of mildew. The room was clean but the carpet was stained which give you an overall feeling of uncleanliness. We had a regrigerator and microwave in our room that didnt work. The best thing about this hotel was that our room had a veiw of the ocean and that its right on the beach. Hotel standards have definately relaxed, my stay wasnt unpleasant, Its a great place for those on a bugdet and not planning to spend any time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “It all depends on your expectations....”
Reviews.Author: Cason
Reviews.Content: Like the majority of Daytona Beach hotels, this place is perfect for spring breakers. Otherwise, you may want to reconsider your options..... We needed to stay in the area due to a famiy emergency and just needed a room for one night. We will never return. The hotel is very old, the a/c doesn't work properly, the beds are like rocks, the pillows are older than me (yikes!), the elevators and hallways are dirty and creepy. It was fine for $100, but not a penny more.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but wear shoes!”
Reviews.Author: klbnyc
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel by a tour company selling time shares. No problem there. We knew why we were there. We booked two rooms, adjoining. One room was great (they both had ocean views from a small balcony with two chairs - by the way IF YOU'RE TRAVELLING WITH SMALL CHILDREN - don't let them out on the balcony unattended - my 2 year old could slip through the railing spaces very easily!) Microwave on a small countertop, refridgerator, king bed. The other room had two doubles (if they tell you it's two queens, don't believe it - these beds were small!) The bathroom had a moldy, leaking vent that leaked on the toilet seat constantly (when you were sitting on the toilet, it leaked on your head!) Both rooms had disgusting floors. If you didn't have socks or shoes on, your feet got black from the dirt! The Staff was very nice and helpful. The location was great. The pool was okay and it's right on the beach. So aside from the floors (we probably could have had maintenance fix the leaky vent, but we didn't bother) it was fine for our needs - not to mention free with the tour company. All in all, it was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SillyShelly135
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay! Right on the ocean, not to close or too far from all the spingbreak commotion. Very clean great ammenities wonderful customer service A+++++

Reviews.Title: “go there if you are single and drink”
Reviews.Author: Stella68
Reviews.Content: We went to our upgraded room with oceanfront view. There was a guy putting in a window when I opened the door. He called on his w/talkee to someone and went back to work. Our non-smoking room reaked of stale smoke as well as the entire floor. The carpets were dirty(stained) I did not want my 2 young kids staying here. I wanted my money back and had to jump through hoops with hotwire and the manager who wouldn't refund me unless they spoke to hotwire. They said we couldn't use their phone to do so. We were asked to step away from the front desk so they could help others. When we got to our nice hotel(Palm Plaza) w/o a refund, we noticed our carry on bag was missing. Someone stole it in their lobby when we stepped back to call hotwire and the other hotel from our cell phones. We left our number in case it showed. The girl said, see it's carma, you should have stayed with us. My husband said if it was clean we would have. If you are single, drink and don't mind dirty floors, it was for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: ksdukefan
Reviews.Content: We were booked here as part of a timeshare presentation. The hotel was fine -- as in previous posts it is older & could have some updating, but not too bad. The bed was extremely hard, but everything was pretty clean (except for the carpet in the hall & elevators). Not sure why most of the hotels in daytona don't have hot-tubs, but it sure would be nice amenity in a brisk springtime evening!

Reviews.Title: “It was comfortable and clean!”
Reviews.Author: kliv28
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, just what it states in it's advertising. My room was clean and comfortable! it had a very nice gift shop and a breakfast buffet that was great and very affordable. When i booked online I asked to be put as close to the ocean (i had a sideview) and as close to the top floor as possible and they gave me THE top floor with THE room closest to the ocean; that was sooo nice! It was very family friendly; no spring breakers (yeah!). My six year old loved the kiddie pool, it was perfect for his size! I will be going here again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Surfside- My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: eryckah17
Reviews.Content: I love the Surfside Hotel. The second you walk in the door you are greeted by a smiling front desk clerk. The check-in process is quick and courteous. The hotel is a great establishment and the service is even better. The view from my room was breathtaking. The rooms themselves are great as well. The rates are reasonable considering that the hotel has so much to offer. Every morning during my stay I woke up to a hot, delicious breakfast in their restaurant. I was able to spend some time with my husband without our kids during the day because of the facilities that the hotel offers. I sent my kids downstairs and they went swimming, shopped in the gift shop and played in the game room all while my husband and I sat on our balcony overlooking the water. We ended our evenings usually across the street at one of the restaurants. We would put the kids to sleep and then end our night with a drink in their bar. WHAT A VACATION! I couldn’t have asked for anything better. The Surfside Hotel has earned me as a lifetime guest. I’ll be returning soon!

Reviews.Title: “My honeymoon @ Surfside Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kazcat
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the Surfside Hotel and we told them that we are on our honeymoon, we were very welcomed and our stay was upgraded for free to a suite. Staff at this hotel is very nice, friendly and they made our stay very memorable. We will return for our anniversary next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not famcy but clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: jmc3
Reviews.Content: from Michigan: This was the third time in the past 6 months that I stayed at the Surfside Hotel. I requested a particular room for the 2nd and 3rd time I stayed there and they accommadated my request. The only complaint is that the ice machines need replacing (or fixing) but the accomadations and people at the hotel were friendly and prompt when asked for service. They keep the lobby and pool area clean and are constantly working to make improvements. I felt safe and I like the location. I will stay there again when I visit Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “On The Way Up”
Reviews.Author: tmeans
Reviews.Content: Give it a chance,this hotel used to be the Holiday Inn and was let go a bit,I found this hotel to be very friendly and helpful to my needs,They work as a team and are doing much renevation to bring everything up to higher standards.It has a beautiful view of the ocean,easy access to the beach,a lovely pool,friendly service and the price is not bad either,if you want the Hilton then I suggest you stay at the Hilton,however some of the reviews I have read on this site do not match what I have seen and experienced,Is there room for some improvements,yes and they are working hard on those improvements.This hotel was definetly not a let down for me and would I stay there again,most definetly I would

Reviews.Title: “Horrible (look at my pictures and you will see)”
Reviews.Author: mattyoglet
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay at this hotel from hotwire so we didnt get to pick it ourself, I had recently purchased a stay at a hotel in NJ using hotwire which was a great experience, however this I can not say was. First thing we arrived 2 days early and asked if we could check in early and extend our original stay to 5 days in total, this was not a problem I was told it would be $218 for 2 additional nights by the front desk man. He ran my card, told me a room number and then after 5 minutes of walking around like he was lost he come back and told me the rate just went up to $179 a night because it is race week and it would now be an additional $140 ontop of the $218 I just paid. I am a pretty easy guy to get along with however this was just plain dirty and underhand. After 10 minutes of telling him and his co worker that this was unacceptable and they cant bait and switch like that I demanded a manager. The manager didnt even come to see me however I was given the room for $109. The hotel from the outside isnt very pretty however once you step into the lobby it really looks good, the gift shop is very nice and they have a nice arcade with a good selection of games for the kids and the pool is very large and looks pretty clean as well. I have to agree 100% with the other people who have said their is a smell in the hotel, you dont notice it in the lobby however once you step off the elevator into the main hall (5th floor anyway) you definetly do notice it. The halls look okay, a bit run down but clean none the less. Our room was a let down, the door that takes you out to the balcony (fantastic view) was rotten on the bottom and once you step out onto the balcony dont look lean out over the edge because you will get wet from the dripping AC unit thats located on the floor above you, I also had some safety concerns with the balcony rails, they seemed very lose and didnt feel like they were secure. the side of the box spring of our bed had a huge stain (similar to a rust stain) all the way down the side of it, the bed was definetly old and had been in the room for quite some time, also the hairdryer in the bathroom had shorted out (probably the previous guest) the hotel promptly replaced the hairdryer once informed about it. Our toilet had a wooden wedge under it to keep it in possition however when you sit down on the toilet it would wobble around like it was going to fall over. Also the AC unit was very dirty and needed cleaned as well as the huge patch of mold in the bathroom on the ceiling. After my 2nd night, the hotel informed me that they did not have the hotwire request and I needed to bring them proof that I had paid hotwire, lucky I had my laptop and mobile printer ( we work alot on the road ) so I printed the info out for them and walked down to the lobby, when I handed the lady at the desk the info she looked at me weird and said there was no problem and I didnt need to bring i down. Speaking of internet, It was down more than up, My wife called the front desk and she was told that it would be down for a few days. A few minutes later it was working again. Very few of the hosekeeping staff speak or even understand english, my wife and i attempted to find directions to the guest laundy (which is located outside of the hotel near the pool) and I was told by a gentleman (housekeeper) that he did not know where it was. Overall I am very dissapointed with this hotel, It is not a 3 star hotel as advertised, The lobby looks 3 or 4 star however the rooms are definetly not.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest people I encountered in Florida.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed our first 6 days in Orlando at a supposedy 5 star resort and it was the most miserable place I've ever been. The staff were rude and the resort did not live up to my expectations. I didn't expect alot from the Surfside but I was happily wrong. The staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was clean, large and relatively well-maintained (we stayed in a corner suite on the top floor). I admit I wasn't too thrilled with the pool, but we weren't interested in a pool with the ocean 50 ft away. I think the value was excellent, room servce was delicious and prompt (though I suggest they provide all day service, not just breakfast) and it was very conveniently located. We never moved the car until the day we left, everything we needed was within walking distance. In fact I became a regular at the Red Lobster across the street, absolutely delicious food and friendly staff. After my experience in Orlando, this hotel was a welcome relaxation, just the place to unwind after wearing ourselves out at Disneyworld!

Reviews.Title: “What Was That Smell?”
Reviews.Author: rocksbox
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a 3 star rating. Who did they pay off for that one? If my booking had been refundable I would have gotten a refund as soon as I encountered the horrific smell in the lobby. The entire hotel was run down, even the television reception was fuzzy. What channels we did get becouse having a side view room we were told we did not get all the channels..Yep that's right guys gotta have ocean front to get Sci-Fi. Also need ocean front for a mini fridge unless (they actually told us this) that you paid $10.00 USD per day for one. Guys I could go on but I hope this is enough for you to reconsider this hotel for anyone's stay except your worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the hotel was recently purchased in April and according to the front desk will undergo a remodel. This was formerly a Holiday Inn (until 11/05) but was removed for whatever reason. All the rooms have a view of the ocean and a private balcony. Our room was older was clean. We paid $79 a night during Memorial Weekend when most places were $119 and up.
